alert.note: Alert for Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 10:30PM CDT until April 20 at 6:11PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a River Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. .Light to moderate rain that fell earlier Saturday on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of runoff. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...RIVERV FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Prairie River near Taconite. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water level nears cabin on Lower Lawrence lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 10.5 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening, but remain within Action Stage through Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 04/26/2008. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Prairie River Taconite 10.0 9.9 Sat 9 pm CDT 10.4 9.9 9.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon by 400 PM CDT.
